definition: to look after/to take care of/to watch/to guard
to see/to look at/to read/to watch/to visit/to call on/to consider/to regard as/to look after/to treat (an illness)/to depend on/to feel (that)/(after verb) to give it a try/Watch out! (for a danger)

sentences.english: The damp rising from the ground caused the walls to stain badly.
sentences.chinese: 地面上升起的潮氣使牆壁的顏色變得很難看。

sentences.english: His face was covered in ugly red blotch es.
sentences.chinese: 他臉上有許多難看的紅色大斑點。

sentences.english: That's far uglier than a yellowing lawn.
sentences.chinese: 這遠比黃色的草坪更難看。

sentences.english: Smoking makes your teeth yellow and ugly.
sentences.chinese: 吸菸讓你的牙齒變得又黃又難看。

sentences.english: P18 2a, He should stop wearing that silly earring.
sentences.chinese: 他應該停止戴那個難看的耳環。

sentences.english: A miss off the backboard then followed an awkward-looking jump shot.
sentences.chinese: 接下來他投丟一球，然後又送上一個動作難看的跳投。

sentences.english: It is hard to see it escalating into an all-out war.
sentences.chinese: 很難看出這場戰爭會升級爲一場全面戰爭。

sentences.english: The worst of Bath was the number of its plain women.
sentences.chinese: 巴思的最大缺點，就是難看的女人大多。

sentences.english: DON'T fall into the trap of wearing ugly footwear just because it's comfortable.
sentences.chinese: 掉入舒適而難看的鞋子陷阱。

sentences.english: It is difficult to see how these bonds will merit an AAA-rating.
sentences.chinese: 很難看到這些債券如何會獲得AAA級評估。

sentences.english: White cement use a month will become a black seam, it was terrible.
sentences.chinese: 白水泥使用一個月就會變成黑縫，難看死了。

sentences.english: The hardest colors to look at together are red and blue.
sentences.chinese: 最難看清的顏色是將紅色和藍色放在一起。

sentences.english: The nail perforated her coat and left an ugly rip.
sentences.chinese: 釘子穿透她的上衣，留下一塊難看的破綻。

sentences.english: And seen from this end of the century it's not hard to see why.
sentences.chinese: 從本世紀末的目標中，就不難看出這是什麼原因。

sentences.english: The scar on the polished tabletop is an eyesore.
sentences.chinese: 這是一個顯而易見的最難看的慘象。

definition: to feel unwell/to suffer pain/to be difficult to bear
to speak the truth/truth to tell/frankly
It is said that ... (at the start of a narrative)/to discuss/to recount
pleasing to the eye/nice to look at
